team-enrollment.select-teams-description:
Below you customize your teams according to your preferences.

You can optionally define your regular and backup players for each team. By doing so, you ensure that all players are eligible to play for their respective teams, and the team can function smoothly without any last-minute changes or confusion.

teams.change-team: By editing the team you can change the default players shown, and who are the backups.
teams.team-index: Team index titulars equals {current} and is allowed to mimimally be {team}
teams.team-index-ignored: Teamindex baseplayers can be ignored for 1st team.

team-enrollment.title: Team enrollment

transfer.transfer-locked: Transfer has already been confirmed, removing it is no longer possible
transfer.transfer-teams-description:
If you would like to transfer your team(s) to this year's event, you can use this optional step to simplify the registration process. By selecting this option, you can transfer your team(s) and automatically place them in the correct event based on your previous participation.

The order in which you check your shifts will determine the order (check everything in the correct order)

You can still change the team numbers in the next step.

warnings.already-saved: New changes cannot be saved in between, please resubmit the form in the last step to save your changes

warnings.title: Warnings

event.usedRankingNote: Make sure there was an update this month

info.description: Via the following link you can find the info video explaining all the details of the new system:
info.title: Info video

overview.description: When you search for a player in the search bar, you will be taken to a page where you can see all kinds of information about a player's results and his ranking. All sections of this page are explained below.
overview.evolution-1: The evolution graph on the right shows how a player evolves through the simulated years. The period marked with a dotted line is a period where the simulations are still stabilizing, so this period is less accurate.
overview.evolution-2: Each ranking evaluation is marked as a dot on the chart. Each dot shows your personal average ascending and descending points.
overview.game-result: For a player, all his results are displayed (tournament/competition), when it was played, the game scores, which ranking the players had at the time of the match and who the winner was (indicated in bold).
overview.levels: At the top right you will see the rankings of the person you are looking for. If you move your mouse over a ranking (or on your mobile phone when you press and hold) you will see the ranking of the player within his own classification, as well as his position within the national Belgian ranking.
overview.title: Overview by player

ranking.description: When you click on the ranking category at the top left, you will see your ranking within your classification, as well as your ranking for each discipline and by gender, together with the player's ranking. Sorting by decreasing total ranking within a discipline is done by clicking on this discipline (or on your mobile phone when press and hold.) By default, the top 15 is given, but you can change this at the bottom of the page. You can also click through to the next page with the next players in the ranking. The discipline itself can also be selected at the bottom.
ranking.title: Ranking

If you have a reduced number of fields, you can set them by clicking on the icon to the right.
